page.title: 01Gazateer entry for Dalkeith
page.content: The area covered has as its focus the town of Dalkeith, with a population at the 1981 census of 11,156. The remainder of the area is a mixture of farming land and estate land covered by trees. The town of Dalkeith lies approximately seven miles south of Edinburgh and acts as a centre for shopping, medical provision, education sporting activity and some employment for its people and those living as far away as ten to fifteen miles to the south and west. However many of the population work in Edinburgh and travel each day by either bus or private car.
